HarmonicFieldPlotter

class pyrit.solution.HarmonicFieldPlotter(mesh: TriMesh, frequency: float)

Bases: FieldPlotter

A field plotter for harmonic fields.

The fields given fields are considered as phasors, i.e. should be complex valued.

The constructor.

Parameters

  • mesh (TriMesh) – A mesh object that will be used for the plotting.

  • frequency (float) – The frequency of the harmonic fields.

Methods

get_field_at_phase

Evaluate the complex valued field at a certain phase.

plot_equilines

Plot equilines of the field.

plot_scalar_field

Plot a scalar field.

plot_vector_field

Plot a vector field.

process_inputs

Process inputs for harmonic filed plotting.

update_title

Updates the title.
static get_field_at_phase(frequency: float, field: ndarray, phase: float = 0, time: Optional[float] = None)

Evaluate the complex valued field at a certain phase.

Each entry in field is a complex number, representing a phasor. Return the field at a certain phase, or for a certain time point. Let \(\varphi\) be the phase and \(\underline{g}\) be a complex value. Then the formula is

\[g = \Re\left\{\underline{g} e^{\jmath\varphi}\right\}\,.\]

If the time \(t\) is given, the phase is determined by \(\varphi = 2\pi f t\), where \(f\) is the frequency.

Parameters

  • frequency (float) – The frequency of the field.

  • field (np.ndarray) – The field.

  • phase (float, optional) – The phase. Default is 0

  • time (float, optional) – The time. Default is None

Returns

field_at_phase – Field at the specified phase or time.

Return type

np.ndarray

static update_title(phase: float, **kwargs)

Updates the title. Adds the phase information.

Searches the keyword ‘title’. If it exists, append the phase information. If not, create it with phase information.

Parameters

  • phase (float) – The phase

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments.

Returns

Keyword arguments with ensured ‘title’ that contains the phase.

Return type

kwargs

process_inputs(field: ndarray, **kwargs)

Process inputs for harmonic filed plotting.

Determines the field at phase and updates the title.

Parameters

  • field (np.ndarray) – The field

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments. Keys ‘phase’ and ‘time’ are processed here and removed. The rest is passed to the plotting methods.

Returns

  • field_at_phase (np.ndarray) – The field at the given phase

  • kwargs – The processed kwargs.

plot_scalar_field(field, **kwargs)

Plot a scalar field.

Parameters

  • field (np.ndarray) – A field to plot.

  • kwargs – Passed to TriMesh.plot_scalar_field().

Returns

  • fig (Figure) – An object of matplotlib.figure.Figure.

  • ax (Axes) – An object of matplotlib.axes.Axes

  • artist (Artist) – The artist

plot_vector_field(field: ndarray, plot_type: str, **kwargs) → Tuple[Figure, Type[Axes]]

Plot a vector field.

Parameters

  • field (np.ndarray) – The field to plot.

  • plot_type (str) – The plot_type of the plot. One of ‘arrows’, ‘abs’, ‘stream’.

  • kwargs – Passed to the plot method.

Returns

  • fig (Figure) – A figure object.

  • ax (Axes) – A axes object.

  • artist (Artist) – The artist

plot_equilines(field, **kwargs)

Plot equilines of the field.

Parameters

  • field (np.ndarray) – A field to plot.

  • kwargs – Passed to TriMesh.plot_equilines().

Returns

  • fig (Figure) – A figure object.

  • ax (Axes) – A axes object.

  • artist (Artist) – The artist
